The methods

udata.views.human(request)

Add a human instance. The user is need to be logged in. If the human instance exists - edit it. At the end - re-generate all CVs of this human by calling udata.models.CV.generate_pdf()

Parameters:
  • request.GET['name'] (str) – the name of human
  • request.GET['web'] (str) – the url of web-site if any
  • request.GET['email'] (str) – the e-mail
  • request.GET['phone'] (str) – the phone number
Returns:

a JsonResponse dict with success statement

Todo

Need to verify fails and response with corresponding message. For now it response allways {‘success’: True}

udata.views.studies(request)

Create or edit existing udata.models.Study instance. The user need to be logged in and have associated udata.models.Human. If we edit a study instance, at the end of this function we regenerate all pdfs of udata.models.CV associated with it by calling udata.models.CV.generate_pdf()

Parameters:
  • request.user.human (udata.models.Human) – The human for how we add or edit this study instance.
  • request.GET['id'] (int) – If the id is present, this meen we need to edit a udata.models.Study instance with given id, if it’s associated to current human.
  • request.GET['inst'] (str) – The name of institution
  • request.GET['faculty'] (str) – The name of faculty
  • request.GET['begin_year'] (int) – The beggining year of studies. Not mandatory.
  • request.GET['end_year'] (int) – The ending year of studies. Not mandatory.
udata.views.get_studies(request)
Returns:a list of studies of current human
Return type:JsonResponse
Parameters:request.user.human (udata.models.Human) – a current human
udata.views.studies_delete(request)

Delete the udata.models.Study with given id if it’s associated to current udata.models.Human.

Returns:

success statement ({‘success’: True})
Return type:

JsonResponse
Parameters:
  • request.GET['id'] (int) – The id of udata.models.Study instance to delete
  • request.user.human (udata.models.Human) – The current human instance

Todo

Need to give success: False response in case of invalid or inexistent request.GET[‘id’] or of inexistent request.user.human.

udata.views.change_language(request)

Change the current language of human. Need for translating reasons and for know what language will be set by default on next accesing page.

Parameters:request.GET['lang'] (str) – a name of language in locale format. Something like ‘ru’, ‘ro’, ‘en’. For now we support 3 languages: romanian, russian and english.
